title: Cowboy Cornbread Trifle
directions: This is a simple layered salad, first, prep all the different layers...
Bake the cornbread according to the directions on the package, except substitute Sour Cream for the milk and add minced Jalapeno to the batter.
Cook the bacon, crispy as you like. It is easiest for me to cut the bacon before cooking. Drain grease and set aside.
Meanwhile, mix the Mayo and Ranch Dressing
When that is done, mix the ingredients for the Cowboy Salsa
Finally, grate the cheese. and sliced the Green Onions.
And now... Assemble... Layer of bread on the bottom
Once you have reached the top, garnish with chopped Bacon and Green Onions.
ingredients: 1 Batch Cornbread (I used a Box of Jiffy Cornbread mix)
BUT Let's dress the simple box up a bit... Replace the suggested milk with Sour Cream (for Creamier bread)
THEN... Add 2 Medium Jalapeno Peppers to the batter, cored, stems, seeds and white membrane removed and minced
FOR THE BACON LAYER... 1 Pound Thick Slice Bacon, cut into 1 inch squares, divided, save 1/4 cup, dice finer for garnish on the top
2 - 16 Ounce Cans Spicy Chili Beans, drained and rinsed
FOR A CHEESE LAYER, I used 8 ounces Smoked Cheddar Cheese, freshly shredded
FOR GARNISH, 4 Green Onions, thin sliced
